H0.text: They are part of the instructions, which is why observation and measurement are important to scientific investigations.

H1.text: They are used to test a hypothesis, which is why observation and measurement are important to scientific investigations.

H2.text: They are required to make a hypothesis, which explains why observation and measurement are important to scientific investigations.

H3.text: Observation and measurement are important to scientific investigations because they keep you safe during an investigation.

A4.text: The systematic, careful collection of measurements or counts of relevant quantities is often the critical difference between pseudo-sciences, such as alchemy, and science, such as chemistry or biology.

A5.text: Careful thought may also entail some definitions and observations; these observations often demand careful measurements and/or counting can take the form of expansive empirical research.
